Description: St Antony and St Sebastian; the saint stands to the left in a monastic dress, holding an open book and a staff, at his feet to the right the pig at the lower margin, his name is engraved "S. anthonius", to the right, divided by a border, stands St Sebastian bound to a tree, his body is pierced by thirteen arrows, below inscription "S. sebastianus" Woodcut with hand-colouring
Bibliographic references: Schreiber 1926-1930 / Handbuch der Holz- und Metalschnitte des XV Jahrhunderts (1232)
Dodgson 1903, 1911 / Catalogue of Early German and Flemish Woodcuts in the BM, 2 vols (A.68)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Theodor Oswald Weigel (sale Leipzig 27.v.1872/151)
